title: Why there are so many French presidential hopefuls
subhead: As a result of political fragmentation, the growing number of figures who have declared their candidacies or are thinking about doing so is making the 2027 presidential election highly uncertain, writes Le Monde's Solenn de Royer in her column.

title: India and EU conclude free trade agreement that reduces tariffs in many sectors
Gregory Bovino, the face of the militarized fight against immigration, ousted from Minneapolis
French lawmakers approve social media ban for under-15s
subhead: The legislation also bans the use of mobile phones by students in high schools. Backed by the government, the bill put forward by MP Laure Miller will benefit from a fast-track procedure, announced by President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Farage's party Reform UK draws increasing numbers of Conservative MPs
subhead: Three former ministers from the Conservative Party have joined the far-right party in recent weeks, which currently leads in the polls. Since 2024, around 20 elected officials and former Tories have defected to the anti-immigration movement.

title: Australia's model of coexistence under strain after Bondi Beach attack
subhead: Following the shooting that targeted the Jewish community on December 14, 2025, Australia's multicultural society has demonstrated its resilience, but the country is still struggling to heal.

title: Tristan Garcia, philosopher: 'Television developed in us a kind of half-sleep and a tendency toward constant commentary'
subhead: For the 100th anniversary of television, the author of 'The Life Intense: A Modern Obsession' explains how the 20th century set 'infiltrated our homes and our minds, to occupy our time and shape our habits.'

Footage shows death of Alex Pretti, killed by US Border Patrol in Minneapolis
subhead: The 37-year-old nurse was killed Saturday after federal immigration agents fired at least 10 shots.

title: From Tel Aviv to the occupied West Bank, a highway of denial
subhead: Highway 1 cuts across Israel from west to east, from the Mediterranean Sea to the edge of the Dead Sea, and then into the West Bank. Used by Israeli workers and vacationers alike, the strategic route plays a role in invisibilizing any Palestinian presence.

title: US seeks to use Alberta to destabilize Canada
subhead: The Trump administration and MAGA circles are closely watching the conservative, oil-rich province, particularly as a separatist movement has launched a campaign to organize an independence referendum.

title: Immigration: Trump's dangerous strategy of tension
Richard Ford: 'I tell my European friends how it feels not to understand my country'
The EU's emancipation from the US requires clarity and resolve
